title: Amarna letter EA 288
text:
Amarna letter EA 288, titled "Benign Neglect," is a tall, finely-inscribed <a href="clay%20tablet">clay tablet</a> letter, approximately 7.5 in tall x 4.5 in wide, broken into two pieces, from <a href="Abdi-Heba">Abdi-Heba</a> the mayor/ruler of <a href="Jerusalem">Jerusalem</a>, of the mid 14th century BC <a href="Amarna%20letters">Amarna letters</a>. The scribe of his six letters to Egypt were penned by the "<a href="Jerusalem%20scribe">Jerusalem scribe</a>"; EA 288 is a moderately long, and involved letter.
The <a href="Amarna%20letters">Amarna letters</a>, about 300, numbered up to EA 382, are a mid 14th century BC, about <a href="1350%20BC">1350 BC</a> and 20–25 years later, <a href="Text%20corpus">correspondence</a>. The initial corpus of letters were found at <a href="Akhenaten">Akhenaten</a>'s city <a href="Akhetaten">Akhetaten</a>, in the floor of the <a href="Bureau%20of%20Correspondence%20of%20Pharaoh">Bureau of Correspondence of Pharaoh</a>; others were later found, adding to the <a href="text%20corpus">body</a> of letters.
Letter EA 288 (also see here-(Obverse): <a href="https%3A//cdli.ucla.edu/search/search_results.php%3FSearchMode%3DText%26amp%3BObjectID%3DP271089"></a>), is numbered VAT 1643, from the <a href="Vorderasiatisches%20Museum%20Berlin">Vorderasiatisches Museum Berlin</a>.
"A summary of letter structure:" EA 288 begins with a short address to the Pharaoh. Immediately, 3 <a href="segue">segue</a> paragraphs begin the letter, as "dramatic statements" by the <a href="Jerusalem%20scribe">Jerusalem scribe</a> (and <a href="Abdi-Heba">Abdi-Heba</a>); a fourth <a href="segue">segue</a>d statement follows. Then the purpose of the letter begins, covering the second half of the letter's "obverse" and the "reverse".
Paragraphs I-VIII (IX), complete the letter's obverse (as seen in photo).
Cuneiform and Akkadian text, EA 288.
"Obverse" (See here: <a href="https%3A//cdli.ucla.edu/search/search_results.php%3FSearchMode%3DText%26amp%3BObjectID%3DP271089"></a>)
Akkadian (with wikilinks).
"Obverse" (See here: <a href="https%3A//cdli.ucla.edu/search/search_results.php%3FSearchMode%3DText%26amp%3BObjectID%3DP271089"></a>)
(Akkadian Text), Akkadischer Text.
<poem>
Obverse, (Vorderseite):
1. [a-n]a mšarri(LUGAL)ri bêli(EN)-ia dša[mš]i(UTU)[-ia q]í[-bi-ma]
2. um-ma mabdi(ÁRAD)-<a href="hi%20%28cuneiform%29">ḫi</a>-ba ardu(ÁRAD)-ka-ma
3. a-na 2(m) šêpē(GÌRImeš) šarri(LUGAL) bêl(EN)-ia 7(m)-ta-a-an
4. ù 7(m)-ta-a-an am-qut-mi
5. a-mur šarri(LUGAL)ri bêli(EN)-ia ša-ka-an
6. šùm-šu a-na mu-ṣi dšamši(UTU)ši
7. ù ir-bi dšamši(UTU)ši ḫa-an-pa
8. ša iḫ-nu-pu a-na mu-ḫi-ia
9. a-mur a-na-ku la-a lúḫa-zi-a-nu
10. lúú-e-ú <a-na-ku> a-na šarri(LUGAL)ri bêli(EN)-ia
11. a-mur a-na-ku lúruì šarri(LUGAL)ri
12. ù ú-bi-il bilat(GUN) šarri(LUGAL)ri a-na-ku
13. ia-a-nu-mi lúad-da-a-ni ia-a-nu-mi
14. munusum-mi-ia zu-ru-uḫ šarri(LUGAL)ri dannu(KAL.GA)
15. [š]a-ak-n[a-an-ni] i-na bît(É) lúad-da-[a-ni]
16. [...]
17. [k]a-ša-ad a-na mu-ḫi-ia qa-a [...]
18. na-ad-na-ti 1(u) lúardūti(ÁRADmeš)[ a-na q]a-[t]i-[šu]
19. mšu-ú-ta lúrabiṣ(MÁŠKIM) šarri(LUGAL)ri ka-š[a-ad]
20. [a]-na mu-ḫi-ia 2(u) 1(m) munusmârāti(DUMU.MUNUSmeš)
21. 1(géš) 2(u) lú.meša-ší-ri na-ad-na-ti
22. [a]-na qa-ti mšu-ú-ta qîšat(NÍG.BA) šarri(LUGAL) bêli(EN)-ia
23. li-im-li-ik-mi šarri(LUGAL)ri a-na mâti(KUR)-šu
24. ḫal-qà-at mât(KUR) šarri(LUGAL)ri gáb-ba-ša
25. ṣa-ba-ta-ni nu-kúr-tú a-na ia-a-ši
26. a-di mâtāti(KURḫi.a) še-e-riki a-di alu(IRI) gín-ti-ki-ir-mi-il
27. šal-mu a-na gáb-bi lú.mešḫa-zi-a-nu-ti
28. ù nu-kur-tú a-na ia-a-ši
29. ip-ša-ti e-nu-ma lúḫa-pí-ri
30. ù la-a a-mar 2(m) înā(IGImeš) šarri(LUGAL)
31. bêli(EN)-ia ki-i nu-kúr-tú
 Reverse, (Rückseite): 
32. a-na muḫḫi(UGU)ḫi-ia ša-ak-na-ti
33. e-nu-ma gešelippa(MÁ) i-na lìb-bi tâmti(A.AB.BA)
34. qât(ŠU) zu-ru-uḫ šarri(LUGAL) dannatu(KAL.GA)
35. ti-li-iq-qí kurna-aḫ-ri-maki
36. ù kurka-<pa-si>ki x ka-a-siki ù i-na-an-na
37. alāni(IRI.DIDLIḫi.a) šarri(LUGAL)ri
38. ti-le-qé-ú lú.mešḫa-pí-ru
39. ia-a-nu-mi 1(m)-en lúḫa-zi-a-nu
40. a-na šarri(LUGAL)ri bêli(EN)-ia ḫal-qu gáb-bu
41. a-mur mtu-ur-ba-zu gaz(GAZ) d[e4-k]a
42. i-na abul(KÁ.GAL) alu(IRI) sí-lu-úki qa-al šarru(LUGAL)ru
43. a-mur mzi-im-ri-da alu(IRI) la-ki-siki
44. ig-gi-ú-šu ardūtu(ÁRADmeš) ip-šu a-na lú.mešḫa-pí-ri
45. mia-ap-ti-iḫ-dadda(IŠKUR) gaz(GAZ) te-k[a]
46. [i-n]a abul(KÁ.GAL) alu(IRI) zi-lu-ú ka-al
47. [a-mi]-nim [l]a-a i-ša-al-šu[-nu šarru(LUGAL)ru]
48. [ù li]-is-kín šarru(LUGAL)[ru a-na mâti(KUR)-šu]
49. [ù l]i-din šarru(LUGAL)ru pa-ni-šu ù [lu-ṣi-m]i
50. [amêlūtu(LÚmeš] ṣâbē(ÉRINmeš) pi-ṭa-ti a-na mâti(KUR)-š[u]
51. [ù] šum-ma ia-a-nu-mi ṣâbē(ÉRINmeš) pi-ṭa-tu4
52. i-na šatti(MU) an-ni-ti ḫal-qa-at a-ba-da-at
53. gáb-bi mâtat(KURḫi.a) šarri(LUGAL)ri bêli(EN)-ia
54. la-a i-qa-bi-ú a-na pa-ni šarri(LUGAL) bêli(EN)-ia
55. e-nu-ma ḫal-qa-at mât(KUR) šarri(LUGAL) bêli(EN)-ia
56. ù ḫal-qu gáb-bi lú.mešḫa-zi-a-nu-ti
57. šum-ma ia-a-nu-mi ṣâbē(ÈRINmeš) pi-ṭa-tu4
58. i-na šatti(MU) an-ni-ti lu-ma-še-er
59. šarru(LUGAL)ru lúrabiṣa(MÁŠKIM) ù li-il-qé-a-ni
60. a-na ia-a-ši a-di aḫē(ŠEŠmeš) ù Ba.Bad(BA.ÚŠ)
61. ni-mu-tu4 it-ti šarru(LUGAL)ru bêli(EN)-nu
62. [a-na] lútúp-šar(DUB.SAR) šarri(LUGAL)ri bêli(EN)-ia
63. [um-ma] mabdi(ÁRAD)-ḫi-ba ardu(ÁRAD)-ma a-na 2(m) šêp[ē](GÌRImeš)
64. [am-q]ut-mi še-ri-ib a-wa-ta5meš
65. [b]a-na-ti a-na šarri(LUGAL)r[i]
66. [danniš(MA.GAL) lú]ardu(ÁRAD)-[ka ù l]úmâru(DUMU)-ka a-na-ku
</poem>
Cuneiform score, Akkadian, English.
Cuneiform score (per CDLI, "Chicago Digital Library Initiative"), and <a href="Akkadian%20language">Akkadian</a>, and <a href="English%20language">English</a>.
<poem>
"Paragraph"-(lines 23-33)
"(Sub-Section 1 of 4)", (lines 23-26)
23. li-im-li-ik-<a href="mi%20%28cuneiform%29">mi</a> <a href="lugal">lugal</a>-<a href="ri%20%28cuneiform%29">ri</a> <a href="a%20%28cuneiform%29">a</a>-<a href="na%20%28cuneiform%29">na</a> <a href="kur%20%28cuneiform%29">kur</a>-<a href="%C5%A1u%20%28cuneiform%29">šu</a>
___ malāk<a href="mi%20%28cuneiform%29">u</a> (<a href="%C5%A0%C3%A1r%20%28cuneiform%29">Šár</a><a href="ri%20%28cuneiform%29">ru</a>)<a href="lugal">Šarru</a>-<a href="ri%20%28cuneiform%29">ri</a> <a href="a%20%28cuneiform%29">a</a><a href="na%20%28cuneiform%29">na</a> <a href="kur%20%28cuneiform%29">mātu</a>-<a href="%C5%A1u%20%28cuneiform%29">šu</a>–!
___ Give-concern <a href="lugal">King</a><a href="ri%20%28cuneiform%29">ri</a> for <a href="kur%20%28cuneiform%29">Land</a>-<a href="%C5%A0u">His</a>–!
24. <a href="hal%20%28cuneiform%29">hal</a>-qà-at <a href="kur%20%28cuneiform%29">kur</a> <a href="lugal">lugal</a>-<a href="ri%20%28cuneiform%29">ri</a> <a href="g%C3%A1b%20%28cuneiform%29">gáb</a>-<a href="ba%20%28cuneiform%29">ba</a>-<a href="%C5%A1a">ša</a>
___ <a href="hal%20%28cuneiform%29">hal</a>āqu <a href="kur%20%28cuneiform%29">mātu</a> <a href="lugal">Šarru</a><a href="ri%20%28cuneiform%29">ri</a>, <a href="g%C3%A1b%20%28cuneiform%29">gab</a><a href="ba%20%28cuneiform%29">bu</a>-<a href="%C5%A1a">ša</a>,
___ Over-Taken <a href="kur%20%28cuneiform%29">land</a>-("region") <a href="lugal">King</a><a href="ri%20%28cuneiform%29">ri</a>, All-His,
24.8.--------<a href="g%C3%A1b%20%28cuneiform%29">gáb</a>-<a href="ba%20%28cuneiform%29">ba</a>-<a href="%C5%A1a">ša</a>
___------------<a href="g%C3%A1b%20%28cuneiform%29">gab</a><a href="ba%20%28cuneiform%29">bu</a>-<a href="%C5%A1a">ša</a> –
___------------All-His –
25. <a href="%E1%B9%A3a%20%28cuneiform%29">ṣa</a>-<a href="ba%20%28cuneiform%29">ba</a>-<a href="ta%20%28cuneiform%29">ta</a>-<a href="ni%20%28cuneiform%29">ni</a> <a href="nu%20%28cuneiform%29">nu</a>-<a href="K%C3%9AR">KÚR</a>-tú <a href="a%20%28cuneiform%29">a</a>-<a href="na%20%28cuneiform%29">na</a> <a href="ia%20%28cuneiform%29">ia</a>-<a href="a%20%28cuneiform%29">a</a>-<a href="%C5%A1i%20%28cuneiform%29">ši</a>
___ <a href="%E1%B9%A3a%20%28cuneiform%29">ṣa</a><a href="ba%20%28cuneiform%29">bā</a><a href="ta%20%28cuneiform%29">t</a><a href="ni%20%28cuneiform%29">u</a> <a href="nu%20%28cuneiform%29">nu</a><a href="K%C3%9AR">kur</a>tu <a href="a%20%28cuneiform%29">a</a><a href="na%20%28cuneiform%29">na</a> <a href="ia%20%28cuneiform%29">I</a><a href="a%20%28cuneiform%29">ā</a><a href="%C5%A1i%20%28cuneiform%29">ši</a>–!
___ "captured-in" warfare, from Me–!
26. <a href="a%20%28cuneiform%29">a</a>-<a href="di%20%28cuneiform%29">di</a> <a href="kur%20%28cuneiform%29">kur</a>-<a href="hi%20%28cuneiform%29">hi</a>.<a href="a%20%28cuneiform%29">a</a> Še-<a href="e%20%28cuneiform%29">e</a>-<a href="ri%20%28cuneiform%29">ri</a><a href="ki%20%28cuneiform%29">ki</a> <a href="a%20%28cuneiform%29">a</a>-<a href="di%20%28cuneiform%29">di</a> <a href="g%C3%ADn%20%28cuneiform%29">Gín</a>-<a href="ti%20%28cuneiform%29">ti</a>-<a href="ki%20%28cuneiform%29">Ki</a>-<a href="ir%20%28cuneiform%29">ir</a>-<a href="mi%20%28cuneiform%29">mi</a>-<a href="il%20%28cuneiform%29">il</a>
___ <a href="a%20%28cuneiform%29">a</a><a href="di%20%28cuneiform%29">di</a> <a href="kur%20%28cuneiform%29">mātu</a>-(pl.)-(matāti) Šeri<a href="ki%20%28cuneiform%29">ki</a>, <a href="a%20%28cuneiform%29">a</a><a href="di%20%28cuneiform%29">di</a> <a href="g%C3%ADn%20%28cuneiform%29">Gín</a><a href="ti%20%28cuneiform%29">ti</a>-<a href="ki%20%28cuneiform%29">k</a>-<a href="ir%20%28cuneiform%29">ir</a>-<a href="mi%20%28cuneiform%29">m</a>-<a href="il%20%28cuneiform%29">il</a>–!
___ also(plus) <a href="kur%20%28cuneiform%29">land</a>s(pl.) Šeri, plus GintiKirmil–!
"(Sub-Section 2 of 4)", (lines 27-28)
27. šal-<a href="mu%20%28cuneiform%29">mu</a> <a href="a%20%28cuneiform%29">a</a>-<a href="na%20%28cuneiform%29">na</a> <a href="g%C3%A1b">gáb</a>-<a href="bi%20%28cuneiform%29">bi</a>, <a href="L%C3%9A">lú</a>.<a href="me%C5%A1%20%28cuneiform%29">meš</a> <a href="ha%20%28cuneiform%29">ha</a>-<a href="zi%20%28cuneiform%29">zi</a>-<a href="a%20%28cuneiform%29">a</a>-<a href="nu%20%28cuneiform%29">nu</a>-<a href="ti%20%28cuneiform%29">ti</a>
___ šalā<a href="mu%20%28cuneiform%29">mu</a> <a href="a%20%28cuneiform%29">a</a><a href="na%20%28cuneiform%29">na</a> <a href="g%C3%A1b">gab</a><a href="bi%20%28cuneiform%29">bu</a>, <a href="L%C3%9A">lú</a>(<a href="L%C3%9A">amēlu</a>)<a href="me%C5%A1%20%28cuneiform%29">meš</a> <a href="ha%20%28cuneiform%29">Ha</a><a href="zi%20%28cuneiform%29">z</a><a href="a%20%28cuneiform%29">a</a><a href="nu%20%28cuneiform%29">nnu</a>–!,
___ Peace for all, <a href="L%C3%9A">Men</a><a href="me%C5%A1%20%28cuneiform%29">pl.</a> Hazannu-(<a href="Governor">Governor</a>s)–!,
28. <a href="%C3%99%20%28cuneiform%29">ù</a> <a href="nu%20%28cuneiform%29">nu</a>-<a href="kur%20%28cuneiform%29">kur</a>-tú <a href="a%20%28cuneiform%29">a</a>-<a href="na%20%28cuneiform%29">na</a> <a href="ia%20%28cuneiform%29">ia</a>-<a href="a%20%28cuneiform%29">a</a>-<a href="%C5%A1i%20%28cuneiform%29">ši</a>
___ <a href="%C3%99%20%28cuneiform%29">U</a> <a href="nu%20%28cuneiform%29">nu</a>kurtu <a href="a%20%28cuneiform%29">a</a><a href="na%20%28cuneiform%29">na</a> <a href="ia%20%28cuneiform%29">I</a><a href="a%20%28cuneiform%29">ā</a><a href="%C5%A1i%20%28cuneiform%29">ši</a>–!
___ <a href="%C3%99%20%28cuneiform%29">But</a> warfare for Me- (<a href="Governor">Governor</a> of <a href="Jerusalem">Jerusalem</a>)–!
"(Sub-Section 3 of 4)", (lines 29-31.5)
29. <a href="ip%20%28cuneiform%29">ip</a>-<a href="%C5%A1a%20%28cuneiform%29">ša</a>-<a href="ti%20%28cuneiform%29">ti</a> e-<a href="nu%20%28cuneiform%29">nu</a>-<a href="ma%20%28cuneiform%29">ma</a> <a href="L%C3%9A">lú</a><a href="ha%20%28cuneiform%29">ha</a>-<a href="p%C3%AD%20%28cuneiform%29">pí</a>-<a href="ri%20%28cuneiform%29">ri</a>
___ <a href="ip%20%28cuneiform%29">Epē</a><a href="%C5%A1a%20%28cuneiform%29">šu</a> e<a href="nu%20%28cuneiform%29">nū</a><a href="ma%20%28cuneiform%29">ma</a> <a href="L%C3%9A">lú</a><a href="ha%20%28cuneiform%29">Ha</a><a href="p%C3%AD%20%28cuneiform%29">pi</a><a href="ri%20%28cuneiform%29">ru</a>–!
___ (I am)-made now (as a) (("rebel"))-<a href="L%C3%9A">MAN</a><a href="Habiru">Habiru</a>–!
30. <a href="%C3%99%20%28cuneiform%29">ù</a> <a href="la%20%28cuneiform%29">la</a>-<a href="a%20%28cuneiform%29">a</a> <a href="a%20%28cuneiform%29">a</a>-mar 2(m) înā(IGImeš) šarri(LUGAL)
___<a href="%C3%99%20%28cuneiform%29">u</a> <a href="la%20%28cuneiform%29">l</a><a href="A%20%28cuneiform%29">ā a</a>māru 2 īnupl. <a href="lugal">Šarru</a>-(Phar.)-
___ <a href="%C3%99%20%28cuneiform%29">and</a> not ((able to)) see (2 eyes)pl. ("Face/Countenance") (of-the) <a href="lugal">King</a>-
31. bêli(EN)-<a href="ia%20%28cuneiform%29">ia</a>, ki-i nu-kúr-tú–!
___-bēlu-<a href="ia%20%28cuneiform%29">ia</a> —
___-Lord-<a href="ia%20%28cuneiform%29">mine</a> —
"(Sub-Section 4 of 4)", (lines 31.5-33)
31.5--------<a href="ki%20%28cuneiform%29">ki</a>-<a href="i%20%28cuneiform%29">i</a> <a href="nu%20%28cuneiform%29">nu</a>-<a href="K%C3%9AR">kúr</a>-<a href="tu%20%28cuneiform%29">tu</a>
___------------ — <a href="ki%20%28cuneiform%29">k</a><a href="i%20%28cuneiform%29">ī</a> <a href="nu%20%28cuneiform%29">nu</a><a href="K%C3%9AR">kur</a><a href="tu%20%28cuneiform%29">tu</a>–! —
___------------ — "Because–of" warfare–! —
</poem>
Reverse, (Rückseite):
<poem>
"(Sub-Section 4 of 4)", (lines 31.5-33)
"Sub-Paragraph—Exclamation"-(lines 31.5-33)
31.5--------<a href="ki%20%28cuneiform%29">ki</a>-<a href="i%20%28cuneiform%29">i</a> <a href="nu%20%28cuneiform%29">nu</a>-<a href="K%C3%9AR">kúr</a>-<a href="tu%20%28cuneiform%29">tu</a>
___------------ — <a href="ki%20%28cuneiform%29">k</a><a href="i%20%28cuneiform%29">ī</a> <a href="nu%20%28cuneiform%29">nu</a><a href="K%C3%9AR">kur</a><a href="tu%20%28cuneiform%29">tu</a>–! —
___------------ — "Because–of" warfare–! —
32. <a href="a%20%28cuneiform%29">a</a>-<a href="na%20%28cuneiform%29">na</a> muḫḫi(UGU)ḫi-ia <a href="%C5%A1a%20%28cuneiform%29">ša</a>-<a href="ak%20%28cuneiform%29">ak</a>-<a href="na%20%28cuneiform%29">na</a>-<a href="ti%20%28cuneiform%29">ti</a>
___ <a href="a%20%28cuneiform%29">a</a><a href="na%20%28cuneiform%29">na</a> muhhu-(<a href="ia%20%28cuneiform%29">ia</a>) <a href="%C5%A1a">ša</a><a href="ak%20%28cuneiform%29">kā</a><a href="na%20%28cuneiform%29">nu</a>
___ for upon-ME, emplaced,
33. e-<a href="nu%20%28cuneiform%29">nū</a>-<a href="ma%20%28cuneiform%29">ma</a> <a href="gi%C5%A1">geš</a>elippa(MÁ) <a href="i%20%28cuneiform%29">i</a>-<a href="na%20%28cuneiform%29">na</a> lìb-<a href="bi%20%28cuneiform%29">bi</a> tâmti(A.AB.BA)
___ E<a href="nu%20%28cuneiform%29">nū</a><a href="ma%20%28cuneiform%29">ma</a> <a href="gi%C5%A1">giš</a><a href="M%C3%81">MÁ</a>(eleppu) <a href="i%20%28cuneiform%29">i</a><a href="na%20%28cuneiform%29">na</a> lib<a href="bi%20%28cuneiform%29">bu</a> tâmtu(A.AB.BA)-(the sea)–!
___ Now (I am) ((wooden))SHIP in the HEART-(middle) (of a) STORM-! (middle of the sea–! )
"End of Sub-Sections"
"End of <a href="segue">segue</a>-(transition), to Reverse" (lines 23-31.5, 31.5-33)
"Paragraph", (lines 34-40)
34. qât(<a href="%C5%A0u">ŠU</a>) zu-<a href="ru%20%28cuneiform%29">ru</a>-uḫ šarri(<a href="lugal">LUGAL</a>) dannatu(KAL.GA

___(the)-<a href="%C5%A1u%20%28cuneiform%29">Hand</a> strong, <a href="lugal">King</a>-mighty

57. <a href="%C5%A1um%20%28cuneiform%29">šum</a>-<a href="ma%20%28cuneiform%29">ma</a> <a href="ia%20%28cuneiform%29">ia</a>-<a href="a%20%28cuneiform%29">a</a>-<a href="nu%20%28cuneiform%29">nu</a>-<a href="mi%20%28cuneiform%29">mi</a> ṣâbē(ÈRINmeš) <a href="pi%20%28cuneiform%29">pi</a>-<a href="%C8%9Ba%20%28cuneiform%29">ṭa</a>-tu4
___<a href="%C5%A1um%20%28cuneiform%29">šum</a><a href="ma%20%28cuneiform%29">ma</a> <a href="ia%20%28cuneiform%29">ia</a>-<a href="a%20%28cuneiform%29">a</a>-<a href="nu%20%28cuneiform%29">nu</a>-<a href="mi%20%28cuneiform%29">mi</a> ṣābu-<a href="me%C5%A1%20%28cuneiform%29">meš</a> <a href="pi%20%28cuneiform%29">pi</a>-<a href="%C8%9Ba%20%28cuneiform%29">ṭa</a>-tu4,
___If "there is not" army-(<a href="me%C5%A1%20%28cuneiform%29">pl.</a>)-<a href="Amarna%20letter%20archer%20force">pítati</a>, -- (lines 57 & 51 are identical)
58. <a href="i%20%28cuneiform%29">i</a>-<a href="na%20%28cuneiform%29">na</a> šatti(MU) <a href="an%20%28cuneiform%29">an</a>-<a href="ni%20%28cuneiform%29">ni</a>-<a href="ti%20%28cuneiform%29">ti</a> <a href="lu%20%28cuneiform%29">lu</a>-<a href="ma%20%28cuneiform%29">ma</a>-<a href="%C5%A1e%20%28cuneiform%29">še</a>-<a href="er%20%28cuneiform%29">er</a>
___<a href="i%20%28cuneiform%29">i</a><a href="na%20%28cuneiform%29">na</a> šattu (MU) <a href="an%20%28cuneiform%29">an</a><a href="ni%20%28cuneiform%29">n</a><a href="ti%20%28cuneiform%29">û</a>, — <a href="lu%20%28cuneiform%29">lu</a>-<a href="ma%20%28cuneiform%29">ma</a>-<a href="%C5%A1e%20%28cuneiform%29">še</a>-<a href="er%20%28cuneiform%29">er</a>
___in year this, — <a href="lu%20%28cuneiform%29">lu</a>-<a href="ma%20%28cuneiform%29">ma</a>-<a href="%C5%A1e%20%28cuneiform%29">še</a>-<a href="er%20%28cuneiform%29">er</a> (?lūman)-"Now, alas!"?)
59. šarru(LUGAL)ru lúrabiṣa(MÁŠKIM) ù li-il-qé-a-ni
60. a-na ia-a-ši a-di aḫē(ŠEŠmeš) ù Ba.Bad(BA.ÚŠ)
61. ni-mu-tu4 it-ti šarru(LUGAL)ru bêli(EN)-nu
"Paragraph", lines 62-66
62. [ <a href="a%20%28cuneiform%29">a</a>-<a href="na%20%28cuneiform%29">na</a> ] _<a href="L%C3%9A">lú</a>#dup-sar(DUB.SAR)_ _<a href="lugal">lugal</a>-<a href="ri%20%28cuneiform%29">ri</a>_ _<a href="en%20%28cuneiform%29">EN</a>_-<a href="ia%20%28cuneiform%29">ia</a>
___<a href="a%20%28cuneiform%29">A</a><a href="na%20%28cuneiform%29">na</a> <a href="L%C3%9A">lú</a>#țup<a href="lugal">šarru</a>-(=țuppu-šarru, Tablet-King, i.e. "Scribe"), ((u)) <a href="lugal">Šarru</a>-<a href="ri%20%28cuneiform%29">ri</a> <a href="en%20%28cuneiform%29">bēlu</a>-<a href="ia%20%28cuneiform%29">ia</a>
___To man-"scribe-(King)", ((and)) "<a href="lugal">King</a>-Lord-mine"
63. [ <a href="um%20%28cuneiform%29">um</a>-<a href="ma%20%28cuneiform%29">ma</a> ] mabdi(ÁRAD)-ḫi-ba ardu(ÁRAD)-ma <a href="a%20%28cuneiform%29">a</a>-<a href="na%20%28cuneiform%29">na</a> 2(m) šêp[ē](GÌRI<a href="me%C5%A1">meš</a>#)
___<a href="um%20%28cuneiform%29">um</a><a href="ma%20%28cuneiform%29">ma</a> 1(=<a href="di%C5%A1">diš</a>)-<a href="ARAD%20%28Sumerogram%29">ÁRAD</a>-<a href="hi%20%28cuneiform%29">hi</a>-<a href="ba%20%28cuneiform%29">ba</a>, <a href="ARAD%20%28Sumerogram%29">ardu</a> <a href="a%20%28cuneiform%29">a</a><a href="na%20%28cuneiform%29">na</a> 2 _šepupl._#
___[ message(=Report?)] 1-<a href="Abdi-Heba">Abdi-Heba</a>, servant at the 2-feetpl.
64. [ <a href="am%20%28cuneiform%29">am</a>-<a href="qut%20%28cuneiform%29">q]ut</a>#-mi, še-ri-ib, <a href="a%20%28cuneiform%29">a</a>-wa-ta5<a href="me%C5%A1%20%28cuneiform%29">meš</a>#
___<a href="am%20%28cuneiform%29">ma</a><a href="qut%20%28cuneiform%29">qātu</a>, șēru, ((my))-"Story", (word(pl.)) (=<a href="a%20%28cuneiform%29">a</a><a href="ma%20%28cuneiform%29">ma</a>tu<a href="me%C5%A1%20%28cuneiform%29">pl.</a>)#)
___I bow, (on-my-back) (="defenselessly"), ((my))-story (words<a href="me%C5%A1%20%28cuneiform%29">pl.</a>))
65. [ <a href="ba%20%28cuneiform%29">b]a</a>#-<a href="na%20%28cuneiform%29">na</a>-<a href="ti%20%28cuneiform%29">ti</a> <a href="a%20%28cuneiform%29">a</a>-<a href="na%20%28cuneiform%29">na</a> šarri_(<a href="lugal">LUGAL</a>)r[i]_
___<a href="ba%20%28cuneiform%29">[b]a</a><a href="na%20%28cuneiform%29">nû</a> A, & banû B <a href="a%20%28cuneiform%29">a</a><a href="na%20%28cuneiform%29">na</a> (<a href="%C5%A0%C3%A1r%20%28cuneiform%29">Šár</a><a href="ru%20%28cuneiform%29">ru</a>)<a href="lugal">Šarru</a>-[ <a href="ri%20%28cuneiform%29">ri</a> ]
___((produced))-"created, "and" 'to-be-good' ", for King-[ ri ]
66. [ <a href="dan%20%28cuneiform%29">dan</a><a href="ni%C5%A1%20%28cuneiform%29">niš</a>(<a href="Ma%20%28cuneiform%29">MA</a>.<a href="GAL%20%28cuneiform%29">GAL</a>) _<a href="L%C3%9A">lú]</a>ardu(<a href="ARAD%20%28Sumerogram%29">ÁRAD</a>)_-[ <a href="ka%20%28cuneiform%29">ka</a> <a href="%C3%99%20%28cuneiform%29">ù</a> ] _<a href="L%C3%9A">lú</a>mâru(<a href="DUMU%20%28son%20Sumerogram%29">DUMU</a>)_-<a href="ka%20%28cuneiform%29">ka</a> <a href="a%20%28cuneiform%29">a</a>-<a href="na%20%28cuneiform%29">na</a>-<a href="ku%20%28cuneiform%29">ku</a>
___[ magal (= danniš), (anāku)-<a href="L%C3%9A">lú</a> ]ardu-[ <a href="ka%20%28cuneiform%29">ka</a>–!, <a href="%C3%99%20%28cuneiform%29">u]</a> (anāku)-<a href="L%C3%9A">lú</a>]<a href="DUMU%20%28son%20Sumerogram%29">dūmu</a>-<a href="ka%20%28cuneiform%29">ka</a> anāku((as verb, "I am"))–!
___Fervently(strongly), (I am) servant-yours–!, and (I am) <a href="DUMU%20%28son%20Sumerogram%29">son</a>-(="Compatriot")-yours ( I(=anāku) = "I am", (as verb) )–!
</poem>
